page.title: 08TRIP DAY
page.content: Every year in May there is a trip day to Kirkwall on the mainland of Orkney. The boat, the Orcadia, leaves Sanday at quarter to eight and takes about one hour forty-five minutes to get to Kirkwall. The boat takes about two hundred and fifty people. It also takes cargo. Most people go to Kirkwall to see friends and relations and to do shopping; getting things that they couldn't get in Sanday and at a lower cost. On trip day you can also go and see the sights, like the museum, St. Magnus Cathedral and the Standing Stones. The boat leaves Kirkwall at about half past five and arrives at Sanday about eight o'clock.
